result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon R Marzicola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Report to Jail, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months if all financial obligations in both cases are paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dillon R Marzicola

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates SAR hasn't been scheduled yet, Ozaukee Co. charges pending, requests a date later this week. Defense would like to resolve matter before defendant is transferred to Ozaukee County.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Dillon R Marzicola in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests a status before 10/13/15 if the courts calendar allows. Atty Gerbers would like to resolve matter before defendant is transported to Ozaukee County. Bond set.
Defendant in custody.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
DA's response to letter from defendant requesting to sentence him so he can get out to work.
from defendant to Judge Diltz asking to be sentenced so he can get out of jail to work. Judge Diltz indicates this is a Br. 1 case.  Per Judge Ehlers, file.
